notes:
Hi, Lovey Howell here. I was married to the millionaire Thurston Howell, but after being rescued from years on a desert island (after what was supposed to be  a three-hour tour), we broke up. Thurston had been having an affair with Mary Anne the whole time, and back in the USA he went nuts what with all the other women around. I wound up with pretty much nothing from the divorce, and had to learn to make a living. So I became a physical therapist for other wheelchair users (I'll spare you the details of my accident, let's just say that the Skipper was not a well man and pianos on hydraulic lifts are not as much fun as you'd think).
Recently, I decided to move. 
Craigslist listed a really nice place for a price so low it had to be bogus.

I searched Craigslist for the terms used in the ad, and found the real ad, with the real rent (way higher). The scammer copied it. This is a well-known scam in Nigeria, where its Nigerian victims sometimes put signs on their houses saying "This house is not for sale". But the scammers don't even have to be on the same continent as the homeowner or the prospective tenant.


For fun, I responded to the scammer. I hope this little correspondence keeps other people from being scammed.
--Kisses, Lovey

RENT QUESTIONNAIRE
 1)Your Full Name?
 2)Your Full Address & Phone Number?
 3)Are you married?
 4)How many people will be living in the house?
 5)Do you have a pet?
 6)Do you have a car?
 7)Occupation?
 8)how long lease are you looking for?
 9)How soon do you intend moving in?
 10)Reason for relocating?


I hereby apply to lease the above described premises for the term and upon the set conditions above set forth and agree that the rental is to be payable the first day of each month in advance. As an inducement to the owner of the property . I warrant that all statements above set forth are true; however, should any statement made above be a misrepresentation or not a true statement of facts, all of the deposit will be retained to offset the agent's cost, time, and effort in processing my application. 


I hereby deposit $___________ as earnest money to be refunded to me if this application is not accepted in 3 business banking days. Upon acceptance, this deposit shall be retained as part of the security deposit. When so approved and accepted, I agree to execute a lease for ___________ months before possession is given and to pay the balance of the security deposit prior to the move in date. If the application is not approved or accepted by the owner, the deposit will be refunded, the application hereby waiving any claim for damages by reason of non-acceptance which the owner or agent may reject. I recognize that as a part of your procedure for processing my application, an investigative consumer report may be prepared whereby information is obtained through personal interviews with others with whom I may be acquainted. This inquiry includes information as to my character, general reputation, personal characteristics and mode of living. 


The above information, to the best of my knowledge, is true and correct.

Looking forward to hear from you with all this details so that I can  have it in my file in
 case of issuing the receipt and contacting you. Await your reply so we can discuss on how to get the document and  the key to you

messages.body:
Dear Mr. Mattson,


Oh jeepers, I didn't look at this email for a while. I thought you were just fooling around, because you wrote "lol", so I figured you were just some kind of joker. Are you serious about this place? I am so ready to move. I hope it's still available.


Also, I am not Eve, I am Lovey, she is getting tired of me using her account here in the group home, and it is just one more reason I want to move. I do not have enough room or enough privacy. When I was unemployed it was hard to come up with the scratch to move, but now that I am now working as a physical therapist I can move out and also get my own computer. I'll get one after I move out, because this neighborhood is not so safe. So meanwhile I do not have my own computer and I can't use the one at the library because the doors are not wide enough for my wheelchair, which is against the Americans With Disabilities Act but that's another story.


I can pay a deposit of course but if you have already decided to accept me as a tenant, why must I pay a separate application fee?


Hoping to hear from you, I gave notice and now I have to be out of here by the end of the month, which is sooner than I planned, so I have to choose between your offer and another place over in Diente Perdido, but it's more expensive.


Sincerely and in healing,
Lovey Howell
